oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Address by Governor Frank G. Clement to the Civil Defense banquet in Memphis, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On April 20, 1954 Governor Frank Clement delivered this address to the Civil Defense banquet held in Memphis. He opens his remarks by commenting on the hydrogen explosions in the Pacific and the "terrible destructive power inherent in our modern day weapons." He comments on the impact of communism on the world and what he believes Americans need to do to respond to "Russian aggression."

The Tennessee Office of Civil Defense was created in 1951 with the purpose of preparing civil defense plans for communities across the state in the event of nuclear attack. In 1984, the agency was renamed the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency.
